abstracts.cdata!:
The project's overall performance
            and outcome were satisfactory as the major objectives of the
            loan were achieved and assessed to be sustainable. Main
            lessons learned were: The capability of the Borrower to
            understand, contribute to, and commit to a comprehensive
            reform program is a prerequisite. The Bank should maintain,
            or have access to, a capacity to more effectively track
            developments in financial sectors of countries that are near
            graduation, or have graduated; the crisis took the World
            Bank by surprise because the Bank was not carrying out
            economic and sector work in Thailand, and did not analyze
            the underlying financial framework nor verify the accuracy
            of financial information. A single tranche policy-based
            operation--such as this project--with the bulk of policy
            actions clearly laid out in a precise timetable prior to
            Board approval, is a focused and flexible approach to
            provide support for structural reforms in a rapidly changing
            situation. It is important to a recovery operation with
            multiple financiers to agree on the best course of action
            which includes an appropriate division of responsibility. In
            emergency situations, the Bank should relax labor-intensive
            activities so that expertise may be freed for more
            substantive analysis and creative solutions, and should
            shorten the procurement process. Sustained technical
            assistance is needed to implement loan conditions and to
            supplement Bank staff resources, and to help establish
            strong relationships with governments.
